result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damon Arty Petty

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant to re-enoll in JusticePoint supervision.

Defendant Damon Arty Petty appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Damon Arty Petty.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Hearing held via Zoom. Scheduling conference held.  Atty.  Corey R. Flynn was recently appointed and would like an additional date to go over the offer and discovery with the defendant.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-04-2022, filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision, LEVEL 4. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT within 24 hours of being released from custody as defendant was remanded. IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order. Defendant to have no contact with Speedway locations and AZ.

Defendant in court. Attorney Michelle Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 01.

Defendant Damon Arty Petty not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Damon Arty Petty not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 9/08/2022.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
